notes.text:
An update for Ansible is now available for Ansible Engine 2.6.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Ansible is a simple model-driven configuration management, multi-node deployment, and remote-task execution system. Ansible works over SSH and does not require any software or daemons to be installed on remote nodes. Extension modules can be written in any language and are transferred to managed machines automatically.

The following packages have been upgraded to a newer upstream version: ansible (2.6.19)

Security fix(es):

* Ansible: data disclosure when a password from the prompt contains template characters (CVE-2019-10206)
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Ansible security update

branches.name: Red Hat Ansible Engine 2.6 for RHEL 7 Server

product.name: Red Hat Ansible Engine 2.6 for RHEL 7 Server

full_product_name.name: ansible-0:2.6.19-1.el7ae.noarch as a component of Red Hat Ansible Engine 2.6 for RHEL 7 Server
ansible-0:2.6.19-1.el7ae.src as a component of Red Hat Ansible Engine 2.6 for RHEL 7 Server

notes.text: A data disclosure flaw was found in ansible. Password prompts in ansible-playbook and ansible-cli tools could expose passwords with special characters as they are not properly wrapped. A password with special characters is exposed starting with the first of these special characters. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Ansible: disclosure data when prompted for password and template characters are passed
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Ansible: disclosure data when prompted for password and template characters are passed
